resources.string: Get to know San Diego, the finest city in America
Photo by Greg Ortega on Unsplash
Photo by Mark Munsee from Pexels
A short summary goes here of what the location is what is there to do why its worth visiting
The Hotel Del Coronado on the Coronado peninsula is an iconic wooden hotel that sits on a beach that has sand that glitters with gold.
Balboa Park sits overlooking the city with beautiful gardens and museums containing items of intrigue for all.
Barrio Logan boasts a beautiful view of San Diego Bay with charming authentic culture and community that is hard to find elsewhere.
Barrio Logan has the most authentic SoCal south of the border inspired food in the cir=ty.
Torrey Pines is a beautiful state park that sits atop the ocean eroded cliffs offering gentle hikes and amazing views for all to enjoy.
Torrey Pines is also magical around the sunset time so it is in both the photo ops and sunset spots list.
13079 N Torrey Pines Rd, San Diego, CA
Calumet Park is a well hidden secret of San Diego, tucked in Bird Rock with an astonishing view of the ocean.
Bird Rock gives surfers access to the ocean from rocky cliffs offering solitude and immaculate breaks.
Sunset Cliffs is the classic San Diego sunset spot, for good reason. The dirt cliffs offer an unimpeded view of the ocean as the sun descends upon it.
1100 Sunset Cliffs Blvd, San Diego, CA
